Title: age
Description: Subtract argument from current_date (at midnight)
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: clock_timestamp
Description: Current date and time (changes during statement execution); see Section 9.9.5
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: current_date
Description: Current date; see Section 9.9.5
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: current_time
Feature: current_time ( integer ) → time with time zone
Description: Current time of day, with limited precision; see Section 9.9.5
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: current_timestamp
Feature: current_timestamp ( integer ) → timestamp with time zone
Description: Current date and time (start of current transaction), with limited precision; see Section 9.9.5
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: date_add
Feature: date_add ( timestamp with time zone, interval [, text ] ) → timestamp with time zone
Description: Add an interval to a timestamp with time zone, computing times of day and daylight-savings adjustments according to the time zone named by the third argument, or the current TimeZone setting if that is omitted. The form with two arguments is equivalent to the timestamp with time zone + interval operator.
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: date_bin
Description: Bin input into specified interval aligned with specified origin; see Section 9.9.3
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: date_part
Description: Get interval subfield (equivalent to extract); see Section 9.9.1
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: date_subtract
Feature: date_subtract ( timestamp with time zone, interval [, text ] ) → timestamp with time zone
Description: Subtract an interval from a timestamp with time zone, computing times of day and daylight-savings adjustments according to the time zone named by the third argument, or the current TimeZone setting if that is omitted. The form with two arguments is equivalent to the timestamp with time zone - interval operator.
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: date_trunc
Description: Truncate to specified precision; see Section 9.9.2
Examples: date_trunc('hour', interval '2 days 3 hours 40 minutes') → 2 days 03:00:00
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: extract
Description: Get interval subfield; see Section 9.9.1
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: isfinite
Description: Test for finite interval (not +/-infinity)
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: justify_days
Description: Adjust interval, converting 30-day time periods to months
Examples: justify_days(interval '1 year 65 days') → 1 year 2 mons 5 days
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: justify_hours
Description: Adjust interval, converting 24-hour time periods to days
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: justify_interval
Description: Adjust interval using justify_days and justify_hours, with additional sign adjustments
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: localtime
Description: Current time of day, with limited precision; see Section 9.9.5
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: localtimestamp
Description: Current date and time (start of current transaction), with limited precision; see Section 9.9.5
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: make_date
Feature: make_date ( year int, month int, day int ) → date
Description: Create date from year, month and day fields (negative years signify BC)
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: make_interval
Feature: make_interval ( [ years int [, months int [, weeks int [, days int [, hours int [, mins int [, secs double precision ]]]]]]] ) → interval
Description: Create interval from years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes and seconds fields, each of which can default to zero
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: make_time
Feature: make_time ( hour int, min int, sec double precision ) → time
Description: Create time from hour, minute and seconds fields
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: make_timestamp
Feature: make_timestamp ( year int, month int, day int, hour int, min int, sec double precision ) → timestamp
Description: Create timestamp from year, month, day, hour, minute and seconds fields (negative years signify BC)
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: make_timestamptz
Feature: make_timestamptz ( year int, month int, day int, hour int, min int, sec double precision [, timezone text ] ) → timestamp with time zone
Description: Create timestamp with time zone from year, month, day, hour, minute and seconds fields (negative years signify BC). If timezone is not specified, the current time zone is used; the examples assume the session time zone is Europe/London
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: now
Description: Current date and time (start of current transaction); see Section 9.9.5
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: statement_timestamp
Description: Current date and time (start of current statement); see Section 9.9.5
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: timeofday
Description: Current date and time (like clock_timestamp, but as a text string); see Section 9.9.5
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: transaction_timestamp
Description: Current date and time (start of current transaction); see Section 9.9.5
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators

Title: to_timestamp
Feature: to_timestamp ( double precision ) → timestamp with time zone
Description: Convert Unix epoch (seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00+00) to timestamp with time zone
Category: Date divide Time Functions and Operators
